description: Brainstorming session for a presentation about Claude Code agent skills being given tomorrow
open_questions: What specific example skill to walk through?
What are Ford's actual numbers for the opening? (diff changes, token spend, revenue)
How technical should the skill walkthrough be?
What's the 'one thing' the audience should remember/do after leaving?

key_decisions.rationale: Credibility through transparency, not bragging - shows 'this is what real value looks like'
Third-party validation of the 'more code, more bugs' problem

key_decisions.decision: Frame agent as 'junior engineer you're leveling up'
key_decisions.rationale: Relatable mental model - audience knows you don't hand complex tasks to new juniors

key_decisions.decision: Include the recipe (Modularity, DDD, explicit specs, docs)
key_decisions.rationale: Bridges problem to solution - without these, agent guesses and makes a mess

high_level: Audience understands AI amplifies whatever you have - skills encode quality
mid_level: Establish credibility through transparency (Ford's real numbers)
Ground discussion in industry data (Cortex report)
